attributes.action: Remove the Value Added Tax charged on toilet rolls and make them VAT Exempt.
attributes.background: Value Added Tax is currently charged by HM Treasury on the sale of toilet rolls at the rate of 20%. I believe that this should be abolished as they are not "non-essential, luxury items" and are an essential item as are female hygeine products which are rated at 5%.

attributes.action: Set up housing for veterans before they leave the armed forces.
attributes.background: Each year many veterans come out of the armed forces homeless. This means that veterans are living on the streets. In 2013 it was calculated that 9,000 ex-service personnel were found homeless. Ex-service personnel are becoming homeless and it is on the rise.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.mirror.co.uk/news/uk-news/9000-ex-service-personnel-homeless-after-2071049

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-us-canada-13983279 

These are links of news articles of ex-service personnel being homeless.

attributes.action: DVLA to review their policies of exemption circumstances for medical conditions
attributes.background: DVLA legislations states that people who are monocular are exempt from exceptional circumstances in their medical section.
attributes.additional_details: I was born with one eye and head neck and facial disfigurement I had driven for 30 years I was legal to drive until DVLA changed their policies in 2013. The condition is congenital and is a non degenerative condition. Therefore the only change is DVLA policies. The machine (esterman vision test) that DVLA use to assess people's vision for driving was not designed to assess people's ability to drive it was to detect glaucoma. Due to my disfigurement the machine isn't fit for purpose.

attributes.action: Make Parking free for doctors in NHS.
attributes.background: At present every doctor has to pay £1.50 per day parking minimum to park their vehicle to come to work. Monthly £45/- to park in place of work in hospital which should be free.
attributes.additional_details: The argument by government is that more people should travel by public transport but the argument against it is that the doctors have to work odd hours of day and night so they need to travel by personal transport if they have one which is not only more convenient then public transport at odd hours especially but also saves time if public transport is not available near to their destinations also the travel by public transport increases the expense exponentially.

attributes.action: Have a set minimum wage of at least £8.50 per hour for care/support workers.
attributes.background: The amount some care/support workers earn is outrageous considering the things they have to endure each day. Care is an absolute must in the community but struggle to find staff purely because of lack of wages.

attributes.action: Impose a ban on leaving your engine running whilst your vehicle is parked.
attributes.background: 9000 people a year in London are killed annually by pollution, about 4million worldwide and that number is rising.
attributes.additional_details:
People often sit in their cars for many minutes with the engine on, I suppose so they can keep the heating on too, or the radio, without running down the battery.
It should be standard to keep a blanket in your car for such occurrences. Parking outside someone's house and belching poison into the occupant's atmosphere should be considered akin to grievous bodily harm.

attributes.action: Review air quality in all airline planes cabins and cockpits-aerotoxic syndrome
attributes.background: Cabin air quality is a very serious health and safety issue which needs to be reviewed by the government in which to make certain of the passengers safety on board aircraft.. This is so that they're is evidence for traces of oil fumes in the cabin air from the engines. Which is deadly and can kill.
attributes.additional_details: Evidence for this is toxicology reports from high class doctors examining organs for traces of engine oil. Reports in many newspapers have stated that it is a serious matter and has killed before. You are unable to know whether that the air is contaminated with the naked eye so passengers are unaware. This can have worse effects on different people. A review needs to be conducted on traces of fumes in the cabin during flight. Filters should be installed to prevent particles getting in.

attributes.action: Clean slate for juvenile offences commited before 18 years old. A second chance
attributes.background: I believe it's unfair to hold mistakes people make as a minor/juvenile to stay with them for the rest of their life. The DBS filtering systerm is simply not good enough, they have been judged already lets not keep judging them 20 years later.
attributes.additional_details: I feel a more fair systerm should be in place. Low level offenders who have not ever served a custodial sentance should be able to move past their mistakes and not have a lack of judgement follow them for life. I propose if an offender does not re-offend between the ages of 18-21 by the time they are 21 other then DNA and fingerprints no record should be held about the young person in regards to arrests and convictions.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to advertise e-cigarettes on television.
attributes.background: Smoking has long been proven to be dangerous to the people who smoke cigarettes and all the people around them. E-cigarettes has given a rise to new young smokers with the chemical involved being just as dangerous but are still being advertised on telly during the day while children can watch.
attributes.additional_details: Electronic cigarettes are a popular new tobacco product that have still largely unknown public and individual health effects. We should be seriously concerned about the potential health consequences of e-cigarettes. This need becomes more urgent as it becomes more popular among children and young teenagers. We must stop apdvertisement of e-cigarettes before this problem grows.

attributes.action: Reduce the minimum drinking age of low ABV alcoholic beverages to 16.
attributes.background: The minimum age for all alcoholic beverages is currently 18. This should be lowered to 16 for drinks that contain less than 10% alcohol by volume, in order to teach youths to drink responsibly. This is successful in Germany, where it is legal to purchase low alcohol containing beverages at 16.

attributes.action: Cut F35 orders for RN and replace them with a capable air superiority fighter
attributes.background: The F35 is not capable of being an Air Superiority fighter and would put Royal Navy pilots at a high risk of loss in air combat situations against super sonic soviet era jets with modern avionics packages.The Royal Navy needs carrier based fighters capable of defeating Sukhoi and Mikoyan (mig) Jets.
attributes.additional_details: The F35 is not capable of dog fighting and is not suitable for providing a close air superiority role. It has been beaten by the F16 jet in close air combat situations and dog fights, this aircraft has been built since the 1970's. This shows just how bad of a multi-role jet it is. It is to expensive for what it is and would save the government and tax payers millions by canceling a large amount of orders.These canceld orders should be replaced by the better Dassault Rafale M or F18 Super Hornet

attributes.action: Consider upping the drinking age to 21
attributes.background: This is to tackle the booze culture in this country where young people go out at weekends, get absolutely wasted and then have fights at 3am in the streets.
attributes.additional_details: Most people do like to return to a local pub culture and away from the thousands of bars that only serve to get people as drunk as possible. Also, It would still be a good idea to revert drinking hours back to what we had previously with traditional last orders closing times. After all, it's necessary to manage this problem that we are having in this country. With threatening refugee crisis, it's becoming more and more dangerous to stand by all soft laws should we protect our citizens. Do it now

attributes.action: Make all cyclists responsible for their actions on public roads!
attributes.background:
Why isn't there any compulsory training for cyclists, why isn't there a way of identifying a cyclist?

We want dangerous cyclists off the road!

Help us promote safe cycling!
attributes.additional_details:
Some of these links will explain what we are trying to deal with:

www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3131256/Has-got-death-wish-Incredible-dashcam-footage-shows-idiot-cyclist-riding-no-hands-busy-London-streets-s-busy-TEXTING.html 

www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/fatal-crashes-are-cyclists-fault-says-boris-7786179.html 

www.leicestermercury.co.uk/Cyclists-fault/story-27759929-detail/story.html

attributes.action: Make prenuptial agreements legally binding
attributes.background: Prenuptial agreements are not legally binding in the UK, making divorce a financial burden, rather than an emotional burden.

attributes.action: I would like you to debate security on all schools in the uk
attributes.background: The Jewish community have now put security In their schools and neighbourhood. This must be a very big concern to take such action. This is the world we live in now........

attributes.action:
Referendum to any change from Human Rights Act to 
British Bill of Rights
attributes.background: British people should have their say as to which one they want. That's all the British people who should have the right to decide, and not just the 36% that voted for this government. It was British lawyers that set up the Human Rights Act and it is there to protect us.
attributes.additional_details:
This government wants to take some of our rights away.
1) The Worker's Rights Directive - this will go and allow Employers to make us work longer hours for less money.
2) The Court of Human Rights will go. It would be harder for us to get justice.

These are just two. There could be many more rights that we could lose if the government goes ahead and put in a British Bill of Rights without the whole of the British people decide in a referendum.

attributes.action: Change school admissions for SEN or disabled children.
attributes.background: Because parents find it increasingly difficult to choose a school under another authority even if that school is closer to the child's home. There is not enough done to support patents especially if non of the schools in the child's current LA are suitable or not where you wish your child to go.
attributes.additional_details: My own experience I am having a severely hard time at the minute trying to get my SEN child who should be attending a special needs school in September we are constantly been pushed away from our chosen school from our current LA because it's in the next LA even though the school is more suited to our daughter she loved it there on an open day and it is 1.3 mile away from home. No one from the LA is willing to help despite it being our request of school it's wrong and it needs to be adjusted

attributes.action: Close the Westminster Parliament if Britain votes yes in the EU referendum.
attributes.background: As the European Union would be making all the decisions regarding Britain a national parliament is an expensive entity no longer required.

attributes.action: Make the hosting and running of revenge porn sites a criminal offence.
attributes.background: Although its illegal to upload the photos to the site the hosting and running of the sites isn't illegal meaning nude photos can be viewed by thousands without the owners consent.  This can also lead to vulgar, demoralizing comments.
attributes.additional_details: Anna Richardson did an hour long documentry titled 'revenge porn' where she interviews victims and perpertrators of the revenge porn community.

attributes.action: Stop poaching healthcare professions from 3rd world and poorer nations.
attributes.background: NHS trusts nationwide frequently poach healthcare staff from third world; developing and poorer Eastern European nations. They are doing this to meet the training shortfall in this country and because it is much cheaper alternative to training domestic staff; causing a shortfall in these countries.
attributes.additional_details: The shortfall in the countries from where the staff are poached leaves the local populations exposed to the consequences of a shortage of doctors, nurses and other healthcare professionals. This will inevitably include morbidity and death in these populations. The nations spend a significant proportion of their GDP on training these staff only for them to be stollen by bribes by our own NHS. This must stop.

attributes.action: Make pointing a laser at an aircraft punishable by going on the no fly list.
attributes.background: Too many pilots are having lasers pointed at them as a joke. This can blind them and ruin a career that could be someone's dream job. They have probably spent years training and invested a lot of money. People who do this need to see the consequences. They shouldn't be allowed on an aircraft.

attributes.action: Protect our ageing workforce
attributes.background: With the increasing age for retirement all employers with over 25 staff on site should employ qualified medically trained staff with equipment ie defibrillators ect, and be able to hold surgeries in working hours,so you can have advice and check ups. The cost paid for by government and employers.

attributes.action: Change specialist schools starting age for disabled children.
attributes.background: last year my son was diagnosed with autism,changing our lives forever. After research and many phone calls I discovered that if a child cannot attend a mainstream school they can't attend a specialist school till reception age of 5!
attributes.additional_details: Doesn't a child with additional needs need intervention sooner rather then later? Us as parents need that help! In my son's situation starting school earlier rather then later can have a huge impact on his communication and social skills with out a shadow of a doubt..why should disabled children be left behind? Because of shortage of funding maybe? I don't know but I do know that families like mine need that stability and routine to start at age 3 not 5! Thanks for your time

attributes.action:
Give Council Tax Payers the option to OPT OUT of some service
elements
attributes.background: I believe every household or business that pays Yearly Council Taxes should have the right to OPT OUT of paying for services not required.

attributes.action: Regulate rip off student accommodation companies and their extortionate prices
attributes.background: Call on rip off student housing companies who charge extortionate rates, tie you into a contract which is too long for the academic year and who continue to rise their prices! Student loans do not get any bigger, tuition fees do not get any lower. Student housing companies need to be regulated.
attributes.additional_details: An average room in a 5 bed student house in Birmingham costs £110 a week per person per week, totalling £2200 per month. However, the same house would cost £1300 per calendar month for a professional. Students are the ones who need reasonable prices as their loans have other living costs to cover and it is impossible without help from parents. Other halls of residences charge even higher prices, with around £130 per week being the cost for a single bedroom and this is still rising!

attributes.action: Create Legislation Making Saturday & Sundays Clearing Days for Banking Purposes
attributes.background: Banks, card companies and payment processors delay consumer and customers payments using Saturday & Sundays as Non Clearing days for payments. In modern society and in the age of computers and automated systems, this is unacceptable and causes consumers and the economy delays in the money chain
attributes.additional_details: Banks state that payments can take days to register into an account excluding weekends. Credit Card Companies and Debit Card Companies advise refunds can take up to 5 days excluding weekends. Internet payment processors also exclude Saturday & Sunday from their clearing cycle, when in real terms it takes only a button to be pressed to action a payment and the computer does the rest. Most businesses operate 7 days a week and consumers live 7 days a week so why is our money regularly held by Banks

attributes.action: Introduce Road Safety Cameras that reward safe driving while discouraging unsafe
attributes.background: Problem is speeding traffic. The Road Safety Camera would do two things. It would capture speeders and issue penalties in the usual way but with an amount of the fine going into a fund pot; then if you are obeying the speed you are entered into a draw to win some of that fine money from the speeders
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.thefuntheory.com/speed-camera-lottery-0
http://gamificationofwork.com/2011/10/the-speed-camera-lottery/
http://thegovlab.org/wiki/Stockholm_Speed_Camera_Lottery_(The_Fun_Theory)

attributes.action: You should be allowed to drive at the age of 14.
attributes.background: You should be allowed to drive at a younger age so that you have more freedom and this would allow youngsters to gain the skills that are needed in adulthood such as responsibility. Driving younger will take stress off parents and guardians and allow young people to gain independence and socialise.

attributes.action: Re-regulate bus services to ensure a better service and fair price for all.
attributes.background: Bus companies, nationwide are increasing prices despite poor service and lower costs to them in terms of lower price in fuel & utilities. Services often have route extensions or sometimes removed altogether which reduces overall bus numbers on the road which leads to longer waiting times.
attributes.additional_details:
De-regulation occurred in 1986 and the private companies run the services without regulation (Outside of London) which means prices can be set at any level the companies wish to set. They look to increase profits more and more each year which has a detrimental affect on the service they provide to paying customers - who rely on these services daily as a crucial transport link to get to where they need too. 
My local bus service recently raised ticket prices by up to 9.4%.

attributes.action: Require all estate agents to be licensed by an independent regulatory authority
attributes.background: There are many stories of prospective purchaser (and tenants where they are managing agents) receiving poor quality service at the hands of estate agents e.g. those who accept more than one offer on a property and effectively play one purchaser off against another for their own financial gain.
attributes.additional_details: Any one can set themselves up as an estate agent. Estate agents can sign up to voluntary regulation and many do. Those who do not often leaver those who are dissatisfied  with no legal recourse as the contractual relationship is often with another party e.g. estate agents and have no contractual relationship and arguably no duty of care to e.g. prospective purchasers. There is some limited statutory regulation for e.g. property misdescription but otherwise legal regulation is limited.

attributes.action: To oppose cuts to Further Education provision in England
attributes.background: I failed in Secondary Education but gained matriculation Qualifications at a Further Education College. FE gave me a second chance. I went on to Teacher Training College then to be a University Graduate and then Post-Graduate. I made my career as a lecturer in FE.
attributes.additional_details: For evidence I can provide a comprehensive list of students who having been given a second chance went on to be Film Makers, Film producers Radio and print journalists,actors,teachers,entrepeneurs etc

attributes.action: Review continuous lawful period ruling for ILR applicants on long secondments
attributes.background: The existing ILR ruling specifies that migrants (non-EU) must not be absent from UK for more than 180 days/year during the 5 year continuous period in order to qualify for ILR. However, this disregards absences related to long secondments outside of UK as part of employment requirements
attributes.additional_details: There have been several cases of non-EU migrants that have been deported because of this ruling (e.g. Dr Miwa Hirono). This ruling mostly affects professionals (e.g. engineers, accountants, academic professionals) working for British companies with overseas businesses as they may undertake long secondments out of UK as part of their employment. If this ruling is not revised, the UK risks losing these talented skilled professionals and the socioeconomic contributions they offer the UK.

attributes.action: Offer Government finance to first time buyers who don't qualify for a mortgage.
attributes.background:
I propose for the government to offer direct financing to first-time buyers to enable them to purchase a home.
The loan is then to be paid back to the government monthly, 
just as a mortgage would.
A deposit would still be required, so that the buyer has a vested interest in the property.
attributes.additional_details:
Banks make it incredibly difficult for first time buyers to purchase a home, even if they have a deposit.
Self-employment, minor blemishes on a credit report, or the lack of a parent to guarantee a mortgage makes things extremely difficult for first time buyers.
It would also 'Balance the books' for the government/treasury, as the property would be owned by the government until the final payment was made. Only then would ownership be transferred to the buyer.

attributes.action: Include emotional wellbeing in PSHE lessons
attributes.background: 75% of mental health problems in adult life start before the age of 18, and yet there is no requirement for schools to teach young people about mental health in PSHE lessons. In fact, PSHE is not even a statutory part of the National Curriculum. We believe this must change.
attributes.additional_details: PSHE - Personal, Social and Health and Economic Education

attributes.action: Censor and ban IS 'recruiting' websites
attributes.background:
Young people are influenced by things they see online - the glories of joining and supporting IS. The government needs to work harder to censor this material, keeping our children safe from recruiting websites.
Terrorism isn't just actions, it's a movement - this starts with ideas put into minds.

attributes.action: DfE to deliver assessment frameworks for 2016-17 as they were promised by now.
attributes.background: The interim frameworks "support teachers in making robust and accurate judgements for pupils at the end of key stage 2 in 2016" were delivered late to teachers. Plus, they're only for a year. The DfE have been "evaluating options for future years" for over a year and still nothing for 2016-2017.

attributes.action: Create a Political Campaign Descriptions Act.
attributes.background: Political campaigns that make statements and promises in order to encourage the public in electing a political party to power, or to vote in referendums, should be subject to the same strict oversight as product advertising campaigns are. We should no longer accept 'spin' as an excuse for deception.
attributes.additional_details:
After the recent EU referendum, it has come to light that key statements made by the leave campaign were false and deliberately misled a portion of the public into voting 'leave', particularly, the £350m that would be saved if we vote leave.

As consumers, we are protected by the trade descriptions act 1968 which prevents companies from making false claims in their advertising. Political voting is an important right, and parties should be held to account for knowingly making false claims.

attributes.action: RAF Mildenhall as an alternative to adding a runway to Heathrow or Gatwick.
attributes.background: The United States Air Force pulls out of RAF Mildenhall in 2022. Mildenhall airport is fully operational and only requires the upgrading of rail and road links which would greatly benefit East Anglia and would be easier and cheaper than proceeding with Heathrow or Gatwick

attributes.action: Replace London with Edinburgh as UK capital
attributes.background: To foster a sense of UK-wide cohesion and inclusiveness, among Scottish people in particular. I believe that replacing London with Edinburgh as the UK's administrative capital would go some way in achieving this.
attributes.additional_details: To counter a sense of grievance, felt by many in Scotland over England’s dominance in the Union, particularly after the EU referendum. The capitals of the USA, Canada, Australia, Brazil and South Africa, are not simply their largest cities. Relocating the capital to Edinburgh will move the political centre of gravity to Northern Britain, where it is sorely needed. Anything that reduces the dominance of London over the UK without diminishing it’s global influence worldwide has to be welcomed.

attributes.action: Add an option for "Protest / No Confidence" to all ballot voting options.
attributes.background: Rather than depending on spoiled ballot papers to count protest votes, introduce an official way for the voting public to express their democratic right to show that they have a political opinion, but they disagree with all the views of a campaign or political parties.
attributes.additional_details: There is a large number of the voting public who feel disenfranchised by our political parties and representatives, who feel like they have no representive or political voice. Spoiled ballot papers are not always clearly counted, and in the case of a referendum can be ignored completely. Having a specific option that allows the voting public to voice their desire to be involved, but that they are excluded from the current political parties, leaders or campaigns is essential for democracy.

attributes.action: Call for a Public Enquiry into TTIP, CETA & all future Free Trade Agreements.
attributes.background:
The EU and Canada have concluded secret negotiations in the proposed trade agreement CETA, which is now in the process of ratification.

Most commentators believe this constitutes the beginning of the 'race to the bottom' in standards and regulations for food, the environment and public services.
attributes.additional_details:
Included within CETA are the controversial investor-state dispute settlement (ISDS) mechanism and Regulatory Cooperation, which brings international trade harmonisation and greater corporate profits at the expense of public safety. It is said that CETA leaves the back door open for TTIP.

We ask this Enquiry to investigate CETA & TTIP, recommend safeguards for the publics interest in all future UK trade agreements and for legislation to outlaw the practice of secret free trade negotiations.

attributes.action: If a fathers name isn't on the birth certificate women shouldn't claim CSA
attributes.background: If women chose not to put the fathers name on the birth certificate they SHOULDN'T have the right to claim CSA unless both parents are on the certificate

attributes.action: Give landlords more power to self evict bad tenants who break their contracts
attributes.background: My husband and I are landlords of one property and have had some terrible tenants who either feel it's ok to not pay rent or flout other parts of the contract. We have just had our rental completely trashed and landlord insurance covers a tiny fraction. We are working class people who work hard.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.facebook.com/Bernard.Bernie.Mac/posts/10154331015367160

attributes.action: Keep the same workers rights as the EU
attributes.background: Keeping the same workers rights as the EU would keep our holiday pay, sick pay, maternity leave, and follow the 48 hour working time directive.

attributes.action: Vote registration system to validate UK citizenship prior to issuing ballot card
attributes.background: Many people unelligable to vote because they are not UK citizens are illegally registering to vote in UK ballots because there are insufficient background checks on nationality. In particular this was highlighted in the EU referendum, where non-UK citizens were voting to remain.
attributes.additional_details:
Background checks on citizenship must be applied prior to registration acceptance to prevent electoral fraud. 

Where people do commit fraud in elections there needs to be a mechanism for criminal prosecution, rigorously followed through by the police and courts.

attributes.action: Potential employers must contact the applicant whether they're accepted or not
attributes.background: I've applied to jobs and although I have one currently, too many people will apply to jobs and receive no no input from the potential employer. To be forced to wait 2 weeks for a job you might not get, to be told you haven't got it after that waiting period is needed.

attributes.action:
Reopen negotiations with EU to agree better terms for UK.
Hold 2nd referendum.
attributes.background:
The EU Referendum was based upon the last negotiations, which failed to satisfy the majority of voters.
Nevertheless, so momentous is the decision, the U.K. population deserve the opportunity to reconsider a further, more favourable, revision of our terms of membership in a 2nd referendum.

attributes.action: Allow Norwich South to have a referendum to become independent from the UK
attributes.background: Norwich South voted to remain in the EU, the only remain constitiency in Norfolk. We shouldn't have to be taken out of the EU against our own will. If we are to remain in the UK then the Golden Triangle shall revolt!
attributes.additional_details: Norwich South was the only place in Norfolk to vote to remain in the EU, one of five in East Anglia.

attributes.action: Parliament should vote to decide when we start negotiating to leave the EU
attributes.background: The UK must leave the EU through a well-ordered, timely negotiation. A rushed divorce will damage us both. Article 50.3 of the Lisbon Treaty gives us two years from notification before the Treaties expire. So we should not trigger Article 50 until Parliament votes to say we are ready to negotiate.
attributes.additional_details: The result of the referendum held on 23 June expressed the electorate's wish that the Government negotiate to Leave the EU. The events since make clear that neither the Government nor the Leave campaign have a plan for the UK's negotiation. So Parliament should exercise control over when the negotiation commences. A Parliamentary vote will also make it easier for the European Council to know when the UK has formally notified its intention to withdraw.

attributes.action: Allow Tier 4 visa applicants use partner/spouse's bank account as proof of funds
attributes.background: Current Tier 4 (General) visa policy does not allow any flexibility regarding proof of money available to support one's studies. Applicants cannot submit their partner/spouse's personal bank statement as evidence. What if they do not have a joint account? What if their parents cannot afford it?
attributes.additional_details: The current policy states that one can ONLY use one's personal/joint/parents' account bank statements or building society statements as proof of money (aka maintenance/funds) available to support one's studies, if one did not receive any official sponsorship or apply for any loan. However, given the fact that some of the applicants are married/in a civil partnership, allowing them to present their partner/spouse's bank statement is arguably rational.
